This website provides information on cases of Crimean-Congo Hemorrhagic Fever (CCHF) in Iraq, the three phases of Dengue Fever, and the risks of Congo Virus and Lumpy Skin Disease associated with buying animals for EidulAdha. Medical professionals are warning people to be cautious and to look for warning signs of Dengue Shock Syndrome or Dengue Hemorrhagic Fever during the critical phase of illness. There is no effective system in place to prevent the entry of infected animals into markets.

No vaccine is currently available, so people are urged to take precautions such as avoiding contact with animals and washing their hands after handling animal products.
